comments.snippet: Reducing the sound created by an app can be a good idea. Though I don't really care as I just set the windows sound scheme to "No Sound"/mute the system sound channel, which mutes almost all annoying popup-alerts. Upon that I put the speakers on mute (I generally use headphones though), so I don't really care to be honest.

comments.snippet:
The "Bell" sound after every use of MultiSSH is annoying. I have the "PuTTy bell" already disabled but that does not affect he MultiSSH bar. mRemoteNG is not in Win10 volume mixer so it can't be explicitly muted. As i can see the bell sound belongs to "System sound" (or at least that bar gets bumped up in volume mixes for a second when multiSSH command is sent)

The global "Mute" option would be more than enough to suppress these annoyances :)

Thanks !
